cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 mi (25 km) south of Cayo Largo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, forecast to cross western Cuba late Monday, then track northwestward across the central and north-west Gulf of Mexico toward the Texas-Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-west Gulf Coast near the Texas / Louisiana border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watches/Warnings issued only for Florida Keys (Craig Key to Key West) and portions of Cuba; none for southeast Florida coastline
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for Florida Keys from Craig Key to Key West and Dry Tortugas; multiple Cuban provinces; Little Cayman & Cayman Brac
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuban south and west coasts, Florida Keys, then U.S. north-west Gulf Coast from Texas to Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Only isolated tropical-storm-force gusts possible; sustained gale-force winds unlikely (â‰¤3% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at PortMiami; any surge confined to Florida Keys and west coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Occasional heavy showers possible Monday afternoon-evening; widespread totals generally under 3 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along southeast Florida beaches through Tuesday.
